conclusion: Determine the time taken for the small ball to move from point B to point C using kinematic equations.
Identify given information: Radius R = 0.75 m, angle θ = 53°, gravity g = 10 m/s², initial velocity v₀.
Determine the vertical motion using kinematic equation y = y₀ + v₀t - ½gt².
Calculate vertical displacement using y = y₀ + v₀t - ½gt² with y₀ = 0 and v₀ = v₀cos37°.
Solve for t in vertical motion: t = √(2y/10) = √0 = 0.
Determine the horizontal motion using kinematic equation x = x₀ + v₀t - ½gt².
Calculate horizontal displacement using x = x₀ + v₀t - ½gt² with x₀ = 0 and v₀ = v₀cos37°.
Solve for t in horizontal motion: t = √(2x/10) = √0 = 0.
Calculate total time: t = t_vertical + t_horizontal = 0 + 0 = 0.
The time taken for the small ball to move from point B to point C is 0 seconds.
